paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the application of nonsense-mediated mRNA decay inhibition to identify breast cancer susceptibility genes, focusing on non-BRCA1/2 families. BRCA2 variants were used as positive controls, but no new BRCA2 variants were identified in the study.

functional_data.summary: Used as a positive control in the study to validate the GINI method.

variants.additional_notes: This variant was used as a positive control to test the GINI method.
key_quotes: We used the colon cancer cell line, HT29, which contains a truncating mutation (c.931C > T p.Q311X) in one allele of the SMAD4 gene and a deletion of the other allele, as a positive control, as well as two positive control LCLs (BRCA1 c.2681_2682delAA and BRCA2 c.539_541insAT).

tables_processed.table_caption: Multiple-case non-BRCA1/2 breast cancer families chosen for GINI analysis

challenges: The paper primarily focused on non-BRCA1/2 families, limiting the extraction of BRCA2 variants.
extraction_metadata.notes: The BRCA2 variant mentioned was used as a control and not as a novel finding in the study.
